intro: Thalictrum minus var. stenolobum, commonly known as the narrowleaf meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its stems are usually slender and branched, with leaves that are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, finely divided appearance. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a subtle ornamental value to its natural habitat.
